member.name: T:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2
member.summary: This should not be used. It is used as the base for EfGenericDto and EfGenericDtoAsync This partial class contains all the code to setup the DTO.
This should not be used. It is used as the base for EfGenericDto and EfGenericDtoAsync and contained all the common methods/properties

member.name: P:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase.NeedsDecompile
member.summary: If this flag is set then .Decompile is added to any query The flag is set on creation based on whether config UseDelegateDecompilerWhereNeeded flas is true and class's TEntity class, or any of the associatedDTO TEntity classes , has properties with the [Computed] attribute on them.

member.name: P:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase.ForceNeedDecompile
member.summary: Override and set to true if you wish to force NeedDecompile as always on in this DTO. Needed if accessing a calculated field in a related class

member.name: P:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase.SupportedFunctions
member.summary: This must be overridden to say what functions the DTO supports. Each method checks this and will throw an error if the service is not supported

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. This ensures that the mappings are set up on creation of the class and sets the NeedsDecompile property based on checking

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.MapperSetup
member.summary: This sets all the AutoMapper mapping that this dto needs. It is called from the base constructor It also makes sure that any associated dto mappings are set up as the order of creation is not fixed

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.CreateReadFromDatabaseMapping
member.summary: This sets up the AutoMapper mapping for a copy from the TEntity to the TDto. It applies any extra mapping provided by AddedDatabaseToDtoMapping if not null

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.CreatWriteToDatabaseMapping
member.summary: This sets up the AutoMapper mapping for a copy from the TDto to the TEntity. Note that properties which have the [DoNotCopyBackToDatabase] attribute will not be copied

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.DoesAutoMapperMapAlreadyExist``2
member.summary: This stops us setting up the mapping multiple times. Don't think it is problem, but mainly a performance issue.

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.SetupAllAssociatedMappings
member.summary: Set up any requested assocaiated mappings

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.GetDataUntracked(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext)
member.summary: This method is called to get the data table. Can be overridden if include statements are needed.
member.returns: returns an IQueryable of the table TEntity as Untracked

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.ListQueryUntracked(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext)
member.summary: This provides the IQueryable command to get a list of TEntity, but projected to TDto. Can be overridden if standard AutoMapping isn't good enough, or return null if not supported

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.AfterCreateCopyBackKeysToDtoIfPresent(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext,`0)
member.summary: This copies back the keys from a newly created entity into the dto as long as there are matching properties in the Dto

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.GetKeyValues(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext)
member.summary: This gets the key values from this DTO in the correct order. Used in FindItemTrackedForUpdate sync/async

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.ApplyDecompileIfNeeded(System.Linq.IQueryable{`1})
member.summary: This checks if the DelegateDecompiler is needed. If so it applies it to the query
member.returns: original query, but with Decompile applied if needed

member.name: P:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.DataItemName
member.summary: This provides the name of the name of the data item to display in success or error messages. Override if you want a more user friendly name

member.name: P:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.AddedDatabaseToDtoMapping
member.summary: Override this to add .ForEach mappings that will be applied to the TEntity to TDto conversion See 'DTO data copying, Using AutoMapper for calculated properties' in the documentation

member.name: P:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.AssociatedDtoMapping
member.summary: Override this if your dto relies on another dto in its mapping For instance if you are mapping a property that is a type and you want that to map to a dto then call this

member.name: P:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoBase`2.AssociatedDtoMappings
member.summary: Override this if your dto relies on multiple other dtos in its mapping For instance if you are mapping a property that is a type and you want that to map to a dto then call this

member.name: T:GenericServices.Core.IGenericDbContext
member.summary: This is the core Generic DbContext that all GenericXXXDbContexts reference, but should not be used by a user of this library Anyone using GenericServices should use GenericServicesDbContexts This interface is used in all the commands so that they can be used by other GenericXXX libraries

member.name: F:GenericServices.Core.Internal.CheckComputed.EntityHasComputed
member.summary: This is the cache used to hold info on if the type contains the DelegateDecompiler [Computed] attribute

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.Internal.CheckComputed.ClassNeedsDecompile(System.Type)
member.summary: This returns true if the config says we are using DelegateDecompiler and the class contains the DelegateDecompiler [Computed] attribute

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.Internal.MappingHelper.IgnoreMarkedProperties``2(AutoMapper.IMappingExpression{``0,``1})
member.summary: This is used to filter out all properties that have a [DoNotCopyBackToDatabase] attribute.

member.name: T:GenericServices.DoNotCopyBackToDatabaseAttribute
member.summary: Place this on a property to stop it being copied back to the TEntity

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoAsync`2.SetupSecondaryDataAsync(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext,`1)
member.summary: This function will be called at the end of CreateSetupService and UpdateSetupService to setup any additional data in the dto used to display dropdownlists etc. It is also called at the end of the CreateService or UpdateService if there are errors, so that the data is available if the form needs to be reshown. This function should be overridden if the dto needs additional data setup

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoAsync`2.FindItemTrackedForUpdateAsync(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext)
member.summary: This is used for update. This returns the TEntity item that fits the key(s) in the DTO. Override this if you need to include any related entries when doing a complex update.

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoAsync`2.CreateDataFromDtoAsync(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext,`1)
member.summary: This is used in a create. It copies only the properties in TDto that have public setter into the TEntity. You can override this if you need a more complex copy
member.returns: Task containing status which, if Valid, has new TEntity with data from DTO copied in

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoAsync`2.UpdateDataFromDtoAsync(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext,`1,`0)
member.summary: This is used in an update. It copies only the properties in TDto that do not have the [DoNotCopyBackToDatabase] on them. You can override this if you need a more complex copy
member.return: Task containing status. destination is only valid if status.IsValid

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDtoAsync`2.DetailDtoFromDataInAsync(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: This copies an existing TEntity into a new the dto using a Lambda expression to define the where clause It copies TEntity properties into all TDto properties that have accessable setters, i.e. not private
member.returns: status. If Valid then dto, otherwise null

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.Internal.DecodeToService`1.GetTypesFromInitialType``1(GenericServices.Core.Internal.WhatItShouldBe,GenericServices.Core.Internal.DecodeToService{`0}.SyncAsyncDefiner)
member.summary: This decodes the type and returns an array of types. If the type is based on a GenericDto then it returns the Data type and the

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.Internal.DecodeToService`1.GetGenericTypesIfCorrectGeneric(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: This returns the two classes of used to form the EfGenericDto. Null if it doesn't match the expected type
member.param: class type to check
the type of the particular dto we are looking for, or EfGenericBase if either will do
member.returns: array of two classes if ok. Null array if not inherited from the right sync/async GenericDtoType

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.Internal.EfKeyFinder.GetKeyProperties``1(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext)
member.summary: This returns PropertyInfos for all the properties in the class that are found in the entity framework metadata
member.typeparam: The class must belong to a class that entity framework has in its metadata

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.SecurityHelper.RealiseSingleWithErrorChecking``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.String)
member.summary: This will take an IQueryable request and add single on the end to realise the request. It catches if the single didn't produce an item
member.param: An IQueryable request with a filter that yeilds a single item
Do not specify. System fills this in with the calling method
member.returns: Returns status. If Valid then status.Result is the single item, otherwise an new, empty class

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.SecurityHelper.RealiseSingleWithErrorCheckingAsync``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.String)
member.summary: This will take an IQueryable request and add single on the end to realise the request. It catches if the single didn't produce an item
member.param: An IQueryable request with a filter that yeilds a single item
Do not specify. System fills this in with the calling method
member.returns: Returns task with status. If Valid then status.Result is the single item, otherwise an new, empty class

member.name: T:GenericServices.Core.IGenericSaveChanges
member.summary: This interface is used by the SaveChangesWithChecking extensions. Uses of the GenericServices library should not need to use this as IGenericSaveChanges is included in the IGenericSericesDbContext already

member.name: T:GenericServices.SaveChangesExtensions
member.summary: This contains extention errors that change SaveChanges/SvaeChangesAsync into returning error messages rather than an exception on certain types of errors.

member.name: M:GenericServices.SaveChangesExtensions.SaveChangesWithChecking(GenericServices.Core.IGenericSaveChanges)
member.summary: This extension will undertake a SaveChanges but will catch any validation errors or specific SqlException specified in ServicesConfiguration.SqlErrorDict and return them as errors rather than throw an exception
member.returns: a status saying whether SaveChanges was successful or not. If not then holds errors

member.name: M:GenericServices.SaveChangesExtensions.SaveChangesWithCheckingAsync(GenericServices.Core.IGenericSaveChanges)
member.summary: This extension will undertake a SaveChangesAsync but will catch any validation errors or specific SqlException specified in ServicesConfiguration.SqlErrorDict and return them as errors
member.returns: Task containing status saying whether SaveChanges was successful or not. If not then holds errors

member.name: M:GenericServices.SaveChangesExtensions.TryDecodeDbUpdateException(System.Data.Entity.Infrastructure.DbUpdateException)
member.summary: This decodes the DbUpdateException. If there are any errors it can handle then it returns a list of errors. Otherwise it returns null which means rethrow the error as it has not been handled
member.returns: null if cannot handle errors, otherwise a list of errors

member.name: M:GenericServices.ICreateSetupServiceAsync.GetDtoAsync``1
member.summary: This returns the dto with any data that is needs for the view setup in it
member.typeparam: The type of the data to output. This must be EfGeneric Dto
member.returns: The dto with any secondary data filled in

member.summary: This returns the dto with any data that is needs for the view setup in it

member.summary: This returns the dto with any data that is needs for the view setup in it

member.summary: This returns the dto with any data that is needs for the view setup in it
member.returns: A TDto which has had the SetupSecondaryData method called on it

member.name: M:GenericServices.IDeleteServiceAsync.DeleteAsync``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: This will delete an item from the database

member.name: M:GenericServices.IDeleteServiceAsync.DeleteWithRelationshipsAsync``1(System.Func{GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext,``0,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{GenericLibsBase.ISuccessOrErrors}},System.Object[])
member.summary: This allows a developer to delete an entity plus any of its relationships. The first part of the method finds the given entity using the provided keys. It then calls the deleteRelationships method which should remove the extra relationships
member.param: method which is handed the DbContext and the found entity. It should then remove any relationships on this entity that it wants to. It returns a status, if IsValid then calls SaveChangesWithChecking
The keys must be given in the same order as entity framework has them

member.summary: This adds an entry to the SqlErrorDict

member.name: P:GenericServices.GenericServicesConfig.SqlErrorDict
member.summary: This contains the SqlErrorNumbers that will be caught by SaveChangesWithErrorChecking (sync and Async)

member.name: P:GenericServices.GenericServicesConfig.RealiseSingleExceptionMethod
member.summary: This can be set to a method that is called in RealiseSingleWithErrorChecking when an exception occurs It should return a error string if it can decode the error for the user, otherwise should return null

member.name: F:GenericServices.Core.CrudFunctions.DoesNotNeedSetup
member.summary: By default the Create and Update services will call the method 'SetupSecondaryData' (sync and Async) which you are supposed to override. As a safety precaution the default SetupSecondaryData method will throw an exception if not overridden. If you don't need SetupSecondaryData then set the flag 'DoesNotNeedSetup' below to stop the call.

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDto`2.SetupSecondaryData(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext,`1)
member.summary: This function will be called at the end of CreateSetupService and UpdateSetupService to setup any additional data in the dto used to display dropdownlists etc. It is also called at the end of the CreateService or UpdateService if there are errors, so that the data is available if the form needs to be reshown. This function should be overridden if the dto needs additional data setup

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDto`2.FindItemTrackedForUpdate(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext)
member.summary: Used only by Update. This returns the TEntity item that fits the key(s) in the DTO. Override this if you need to include any related entries when doing a complex update.

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDto`2.CreateDataFromDto(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext,`1)
member.summary: This is used in a create. It copies only the properties in TDto that have public setter into the TEntity. You can override this if you need a more complex copy
member.returns: status which, if Valid, has new TEntity with data from DTO copied in

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDto`2.UpdateDataFromDto(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext,`1,`0)
member.summary: This is used in an update. It copies only the properties in TDto that do not have the [DoNotCopyBackToDatabase] on them. You can override this if you need a more complex copy
member.return: status. destination is only valid if status.IsValid

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.EfGenericDto`2.DetailDtoFromDataIn(GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: This copies an existing TEntity into a new dto using a Lambda expression to define the where clause It copies TEntity properties into all TDto properties that have accessable setters, i.e. not private
member.returns: status. If valid result is dto. Otherwise null

member.name: M:GenericServices.Core.InstrumentedEfGenericDto`2.LogSpecificName(System.String,GenericServices.Core.CallTypes)
member.summary: Instrumentation method which allows a specific point to be logged with a given name
member.param: defaults to Point

member.summary: Thsi will log the name of the calling method

Do not use. Filled in by system with the calling method name

member.returns: status. If valid result is dto. Otherwise null if not found

member.name: P:GenericServices.Core.InstrumentedEfGenericDto`2.FunctionsCalledCommaDelimited

member.summary: This holds the methods to delete an entry from the database

member.summary: This will delete an item from the database

member.name: M:GenericServices.IDeleteService.DeleteWithRelationships``1(System.Func{GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext,``0,GenericLibsBase.ISuccessOrErrors},System.Object[])
member.summary: This allows a developer to delete an entity plus any of its relationships. The first part of the method finds the given entity using the provided keys. It then calls the deleteRelationships method which should remove the extra relationships
member.param: method which is handed the DbContext and the found entity. It should then remove any relationships on this entity that it wants to. It returns a status, if IsValid then calls SaveChangesWithChecking
The keys must be given in the same order as entity framework has them

member.name: T:GenericServices.IGenericServicesDbContext
member.summary: This is the interface that developers should placed on the DbContext in there project It will allow the GenericServices commands to woek with your context Also useful for dependency injection.
